author: Laura Connor
title: Karen Matthews was my close friend - but I knew she'd kidnapped her own daughter Shannon
text:
Karen Matthews' neighbour reveals she had early suspicions Share this video Watch Next 
As shown in the new two-part programme, Natalie is the only person among Karen’s friends and neighbours to suggest Karen might have been involved. 
One scene shows her fears being dismissed by her husband, who insists the pair should be out celebrating Shannon’s safe return. 
But Natalie says there were obvious tell-tale signs even before Shannon was found. 
“Karen came to stay at my house and when the TV cameras weren’t around I realised that it was as if she didn’t care, she was back to her normal, happy self,” Natalie says. 
“Something just wasn’t right. I remember one time, Karen wanted to watch the news and Shannon’s picture came on the TV. Karen Matthews planned the abduction of her own daughter, Shannon (Photo: Daily Mirror) 
“My oldest daughter said: ‘I can’t wait for Shannon to come home.’ I said, being the honest mum I am, ‘well, it’s not guaranteed she’s going to come home so we need to prepare ourselves if that happens.’ 
“Karen turned around and said: ‘Look she’s famous now, she’s on TV. Don’t worry, she’s coming home.’ 
“I told Karen she couldn’t give the kids false hope, and she looked straight at my daughter and said: ‘I know she’s coming home.’ 
“It was that comment, it was that moment, I just thought: ‘Hang on.’ 
“I noticed she was smiling around the cameras and, as a mother myself, I just thought: ‘I wouldn’t want to be in front of the cameras, I would be doing exactly what the police told me to do. I would want to be at home with my remaining children.’ Karen Matthew being led from Dewsbury police station (Photo: PA) 
“It was lots of little things building up. 
“But when I raised my suspicions with anyone such as my husband or Julie about the way Karen was acting, they would tell me I was being paranoid and reading into things.” 
When Shannon was eventually found on March 14, the community was overjoyed. 
But Natalie became even more concerned – and had good reason to be. 
Shannon was found hidden in Donovan’s flat in nearby Batley Carr after being drugged with sedatives to keep quiet. 
Drug tests revealed she had been drugged for up to 20 months before the incident. 
“When we were told a girl had been found, we were all so relieved we were shouting and screaming,” remembers Natalie. But Karen was just so blase about it.” 
As Karen heard the news, she walked away from her suspicious friend, who believes she had already been distancing herself because she knew Natalie feared something was amiss. 
Karen, who has seven children by five different dads, went into the kitchen where she started insisting everything must be tidied up and started emptying bins. Karen Matthews police mugshot (Photo: PA) 
Natalie says: “I said: ‘What are you doing? They have just told you they might have found Shannon!’ She had to be told by the family liaison officer to leave to go and see her at the station. 
“The last thing on my mind if someone told they had found my child would be to clean my house.” 
When Karen arrived at the police station, she is shown in the drama as completely emotionless when seeing Shannon through one-way glass. 
“If that had been my child behind that glass I would have been doing everything I could to get to her and give her a hug,” says Natalie. 
“But the family liaison office told me Karen just did nothing.” 
Eventually Karen confessed – but Natalie still doesn’t believe the full truth has been revealed. Natalie Brown friend and neighbour of Karen Matthews (Photo: Ross Parry Agency) 
Karen told Natalie and Julie that she had arranged for Shannon go away from home as part of a plan to leave her partner, Craig Meehan. 
The trio were sat in a police car when she admitted asking Donovan, who was also given an eight-year sentence, to look after Shannon while she broke up with Meehan. 
Natalie told the Leeds Crown Court trial about Karen’s confession, but she’s still not convinced. 
She believes it was just another lie told by Karen as her deception spun wildly out of control. 
“She told lie upon lie upon lie upon lie,” Natalie says. 
“I think this was just a way of her getting out of it, by supposedly confessing. I hated giving evidence again her. 
“I looked at her in court and she wouldn’t even look me in the eye. I just stood there and thought: ‘Is that how much our friendship meant to you?’” A community devastated after Karen Matthews was unmasked (Photo: Copyright unknown) 
Karen sobbed in the dock as she gave evidence, denying she had anything to do with Shannon’s disappearance and blaming the kidnap on Donovan. 
But the jury were unconvinced and found both her and her co-accused guilty. 
Since being released on licence in 2012, Karen has begged for forgiveness, saying she has turned to God as she tries to turn her life around. 
But it still affects Natalie, who says the new adaption is so true to life, she cried remembering that hellish time nine years ago. 
“The estate got such a bad reputation but I actually think there is a side to the story that wasn’t told,” she says. 
“It was about a whole community coming together and looking for a child that had gone missing. 
“So this programme shows a different side to Dewsbury. It shows the real story.” Read More
